betterquesting:10.desc:8:
While the matter of weapons capable of planetary destruction should not be ignored, it is not the sole issue I shall contend with here in Greckon.
This place is permeated by entropy-manipulating magic. Chaos, in its inevitability rules this place.
This power is a strange one. In a way, it reminds me of the Meatball Man's own powers, but in a different form. 
Everyone desires, and it is easy to desire too much. That is the inevitability of the Meatball Man's powers. There will always be someone to fall under his wing, always.
Similarly, all creatures traverse time, and contribute to the entropy of the universe. That is a subtle inevitability, but it is nevertheless an inevitability. Everyone, in their own way, will produce chaos, and the power that lingers in this place, is there to devour it, and turn it into ghouls and other misshapen creatures.
Even the minerals in the soil of Greckon fall under this influence.
